title: Job Openings at Bluradish
content:
Bluradish is a modern, customer-centric luxury pawnshop brand committed to providing fast, reliable, and discreet financial solutions. We specialize in short-term loans secured against high-value luxury items such as watches, designer fashion, jewelry, and electronics. Our approach blends professionalism, confidentiality, and a high-end retail experience that sets us apart in the industry.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Executive Assistant to the Managing Director

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a highly organized, polished, and proactive Executive Assistant to support the Managing Director in driving the strategic and operational goals of the business.
	The ideal candidate will have 3–5 years of experience supporting C-level executives, preferably within a luxury business environment (e.g., fashion, retail, hospitality, or lifestyle brands).
	The Executive Assistant will serve as a trusted gatekeeper and project coordinator, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and helping the MD stay focused on leadership and business development.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide high-level administrative support to the Managing Director, including calendar management, travel arrangements, meeting scheduling, and email correspondence.
	Serve as the first point of contact and liaison between the MD and internal/external stakeholders, clients, and partners.
	Prepare, review, and organize documents, reports, presentations, and meeting agendas.
	Coordinate business meetings, events, and confidential matters with discretion and professionalism.
	Track and follow up on action items, deadlines, and project milestones on behalf of the MD.
	Handle confidential information with integrity and professionalism.
	Assist with personal executive tasks as needed to support the overall performance of the MD.
	Stay attuned to the luxury brand voice and assist in communications, brand-related tasks, and special projects when required.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Communications, or related field
	3 - 5 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant supporting senior executives, ideally in a luxury-focused business or corporate environment
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills with a proactive, detail-oriented approach
	Impeccable verbal and written communication skills
	High emotional intelligence, discretion, and professionalism
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and virtual communication tools (e.g., Zoom, Teams)
	A strong appreciation and understanding of luxury aesthetics, customer service, and brand tone
	Must be based in Lagos


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience in luxury retail, hospitality, or fashion industries
	Familiarity with executive calendar tools, project management platforms (e.g., Asana, Trello), and CRM systems
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment


Why Join Bluradish?


	Opportunity to work closely with a visionary founder in a dynamic, upscale business
	Exposure to the luxury retail and financial services industries
	High-impact role with opportunities for professional growth
	Elegant and collaborative workplace culture


Application Closing Date: 13th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: career@pawnshopbyblu.com using “Application – Executive Assistant” as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Pawning & Evaluation Specialist

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented, stylish, and customer-focused Pawning & Evaluation Specialist with a keen eye for luxury products especially watches and designer fashion.
	The ideal candidate will have a background in luxury retail and a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences.
	You will be responsible for evaluating luxury items, advising clients, and ensuring seamless pawning transactions with the utmost discretion and accuracy.


Key Responsibilities


	Evaluate and authenticate luxury items such as watches, handbags, fashion pieces, and other valuables for pawning or resale.
	Conduct in-person assessments of items brought by clients, considering market value, brand, condition, and authenticity.
	Offer fair and informed pawn valuations based on current resale market and internal guidelines.
	Educate and assist clients through the pawning process with professionalism, empathy, and transparency.
	Maintain accurate records of transactions, valuations, and client interactions.
	Collaborate with the finance and customer experience teams to ensure timely disbursements and follow-ups.
	Maintain awareness of luxury market trends and pricing.
	Uphold the brand image and ensure the store space reflects our values of class, luxury, and discretion.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a BSc Degree in any relevant field
	Proven experience in luxury retail, preferably with high-end watch brands or fashion labels (e.g., Rolex, Omega, Chanel, Louis Vuitton, etc.)
	Gender: Female
	Strong product knowledge and experience handling luxury items
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
	Strong attention to detail and the ability to identify counterfeit or altered goods
	Professional appearance and polished demeanor
	Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced environment
	Trustworthy, discreet, and reliable.


Preferred Skills:


	Prior experience in a pawning or financial services environment is an added advantage
	Familiarity with pricing tools, appraisal techniques, or authentication procedures
	Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office and CRM tools.


Why Join Bluradish?


	Work in a premium, customer-focused environment
	Be part of a growing and innovative brand redefining the pawn industry
	Opportunities for career growth and personal development
	Collaborative and supportive team culture.


Application Closing Date: 4th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: career@pawnshopbyblu.com using “Application - Pawning & Evaluation Specialist” as the subject of the email.

Note: If you are passionate about luxury retail, have an eye for detail, and are excited about making a real impact in a growing brand, we’d love to hear from you. 

 

 

3.) Pawning and Valuation Specialist

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Gender Requirement: Female

Role Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented, stylish, and customer-focused Pawning & Evaluation Specialist with a keen eye for luxury products especially watches and designer fashion.
	The ideal candidate will have a background in luxury retail and a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences.
	You will be responsible for evaluating luxury items, advising clients, and ensuring seamless pawning transactions with the utmost discretion and accuracy.

Requirements


	Gender: Female

	 Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc Degree with 2 - 6 years of work experience. 
	Proven experience in luxury retail, preferably with high-end watch brands or fashion labels (e.g., Rolex, Omega, Chanel, Louis Vuitton, etc.)
	Strong attention to detail and the ability to identify counterfeit or altered goods
	Professional appearance and polished demeanor
	Strong product knowledge and experience handling luxury items
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced environment
	Trustworthy, discreet, and reliable


Preferred Skills:


	Prior experience in a pawning or financial services environment is an added advantage
	Familiarity with pricing tools, appraisal techniques, or authentication procedures
	Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office and CRM tools.


Why Join Bluradish?


	Work in a premium, customer-focused environment
	Be part of a growing and innovative brand redefining the pawn industry
	Opportunities for career growth and personal development
	Collaborative and supportive team culture.


Application Closing Date: 10th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: career@pawnshopbyblu.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: If you are passionate about luxury retail, have an eye for detail, and are excited about making a real impact in a growing brand, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Officer Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Officer

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Officer will be responsible for managing and optimizing the HRIS database to ensure the accurate collection, management, and reporting of employee data.
	This role will involve working closely with HR teams to automate processes and enhance data accessibility, thus supporting strategic HR decision-making.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the HRIS to ensure system integrity and accuracy of data.
	Support HR initiatives by maintaining employee data and ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.
	Collaborate with IT for system upgrades, troubleshooting issues, and maintaining system security.
	Conduct regular audits of employee data to ensure accuracy and compliance.
	Stay updated on HRIS best practices and emerging technologies. 
	Develop and generate reports and analytics to inform HR strategies and improve operational efficiencies.
	Assist in the design and implementation of new HRIS modules and features.
	Provide training and support to HR personnel and end-users on HRIS functionalities.
	Participate in change management initiatives relating to HRIS updates.


Requirement & Competencies


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, Business Administration or a related field.
	Proven experience working as an HRIS Officer or similar role.
	Strong understanding of HR processes and data management.
	Proficiency in HRIS software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Workday) and advanced Excel skills.
	Knowledge of database management and data security standards.
	Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Opportunities for Professional Growth and Career Advancement
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development
	Competitive salary
	Collaborative and supportive work environment.

Job Location: Lagos

	Certifications: BOSIET/HUET, Advanced DP familiarity

3.) Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers - Site & Head Office (as required)
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Engineering
Reports To: Project Manager / MEP Coordinator

Job Purpose


	Candidate will oversee the planning, design, and execution of electrical systems in mechanical, piping, and process-driven projects.
	This includes supervision of site activities, ensuring electrical systems support fabrication, welding, and installation equipment, and ensuring compliance with standards, safety, and client specifications.


Responsibilities
Design & Engineering Support:


	Will develop and interpret electrical designs and layouts for equipment powering pipe fabrication, welding stations, HVAC, lighting, and instrumentation.
	Will design power distribution systems, grounding, cable routing, and panel schedules.
	Ensure integration of electrical systems with mechanical and process units.


Site Installation & Supervision:


	Supervise installation of electrical systems for
	Welding machines
	Heavy-duty equipment (grinders, cranes, compressors)
	Lighting and power points
	Control panels and junction boxes
	Ensure correct load distribution, safety interlocks, and proper earthing.


Project Planning & Execution:


	Prepare BOQs, technical specifications, and shop drawings.
	Support procurement team with technical input on electrical materials.
	Coordinate with piping, mechanical, and civil teams for sequencing and interfacing.


Testing, Commissioning & Maintenance:


	Perform loop checks, megger tests, and load trials on connected systems.
	Commission control systems for automated welding or fabrication machines.
	Maintain backup power systems (generators, UPS, etc.).


Documentation & Compliance:


	Develop and maintain method statements, risk assessments, and QA/QC documentation.
	Ensure adherence to Nigerian Electrical Code, IEE, IEC, or NEC standards.
	Liaise with consultants and client inspectors for approvals.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education: B.Sc./B.Eng. or HND in Electrical Engineering.
	Experience: 5 – 8 years in MEP, industrial fabrication, or construction projects.
	Certifications: COREN, NSE, or similar professional body is an advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of industrial electrical systems and controls.
	Familiar with electrical safety standards, permit-to-work systems, and lock-out/tag-out.
	Ability to read P&IDs and work with Instrumentation & Control teams.
	Proficient in AutoCAD, Revit MEP, and MS Excel.
	Effective leadership, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 9th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@kineticelectromechanic.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at Bell Oil & Gas
content:
Bell Oil & Gas was incorporated in January 2002 and has experienced unprecedented growth in the Nigerian oil industry. The company is an independent oil services company which was formed and wholly-owned by Nigerians. We have quick access to international markets via our geographical spread and technology, together with access to international lines of credit Our vast experience cuts across several facets of the industry, together with affiliations with a number of reputable foreign companies. We are professional in applying this instinctive knowledge and experience to addressing your ongoing requirements efficiently and cost-effectively.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Bell Oil & Gas has the reach and means to deliver high quality products and services. We understand first hand, the complexities and issues facing our industry, together with a strong grounding of the Nigerian culture and ways of conducting business. We are able to respond swiftly to our clients' requirements in a unique way.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Liaison Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Overall, Purpose of Job


	To develop and manage relationships with key industry stakeholders and regulators for business development and business generation purposes.
	Obtain accurate and timely market/project intelligence for effective project/tender tracking and monitoring.


Job Responsibilities


	Manage, supervise, perform and coordinate all functions relating to liaison, government relations, client relations and Nigerian content.
	Establish and maintain strong relationships with key government officials, regulators, and policymakers within the NCDMB, Nigerian Upstream Petroleum Regulatory Commission (NUPRC), NNPC Upstream Investment Management Services (NUIMS) and other related industry agencies.
	Use contacts in related government agencies to generate/secure business/win bids for the company
	Gather intelligence about ongoing and upcoming projects/tenders, come up with strategies to position the company for success.
	Facilitate communication and collaboration between the company and regulatory agencies.
	Monitori government /industrypolicy changes, changes in legislation and representing the company's interests in regulatory matters.
	Monitor competitor activities and advise company management.
	Manage and supervise Nigerian content development activities of the company.
	Liaise with and continually manage the company’s relations with the Nigerian Content Development and Monitoring Board (NCDMB) where necessary.
	Liaise with and continually manage the company’s relations with the National Assembly, the Presidency, ministries and other govern parastatals.
	Ensure the company is up to date and in line with all the laws, rules and regulations.
	Support the Project Management teams in Lagos and Port Harcourt where necessary through tender tracking.
	Perform other duties as directed by the company management.


Specification


	Level of education/qualifications normally required: A good university degree
	Specific Work experience: Minimum of 4 years cognate experience.


Technical / Functional Skills:


	Good general knowledge of Oil field operations in both Onshore and Offshore locations
	Good planning and organizational skills, can work independently with minimal supervision
	Strong computer Skills especially Excel, word, PowerPoint, and email applications
	People skills, demonstrate ability to work with diverse workforce effectively.


Behavioral competence:


	Strong interpersonal skills
	Experience and track record in managing relationships with key indystry and government regulators
	Strong team player
	Adaptable
	Tact and tolerance
	Ability to work well under pressure and adhere to set deadlines
	Resilient and Motivated.


Leadership and managerial abilities:


	Ability to communicate effectively and clearly to clients and project team members
	Demonstrated ability to handle multiple assignments concurrently without sacrificing quality.
	Able to focus work activities on goals and project needs.
	Ability to maintain positive relationships with key government officials, peers, subcontractors, superiors, customers and subordinates.
	Interpersonal skills
	Relationship management skills
	Reporting and intelligence gathering skills
	Verbal and written communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 17th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV as an attachment to: manpower@belloil.com using the Job Position as subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Experienced Project Management Professional

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Operations Manager

Overall Purpose of Job


	Ensure the compilation of bids, collection of projects data and the planning, analysis and management of projects.


Responsibilities 


	Supervises the preparation of bids/proposals.
	Reviews ALL tender documents and supervises compilation of materials required for bids.
	Ensures the preparation of pre-qualification bids with standard company information.
	Puts together technical bids.
	Consolidates and compiles commercial bids.
	Supports the planning and co-ordination of all field operations in the space of CPS, WT and Hydraulics
	Oversee the assembly of resources (Personnel, PPEs, Equipment and Consumables) for all field operations teams.
	Ensure appropriate site visits for all field projects and the compilation of site visit reports.
	Oversee the provision of adequate materials/personnel for each project team.
	Ensure timely mobilization for each field project.
	Oversee the provision of adequate materials, personnel and equipment for field service operations
	Ensure that field operations equipment meet industry standard and are fit for purpose
	Oversee subcontractor activities and client meetings when required
	Ensure confidentiality in all commercial issues handled
	Promote innovative cost saving ideas
	Oversee certification of equipment for field operation and ensure proper documentation
	Ensure Procedure compliance by subordinates
	Contribute to formulation of policies
	Formulate goals/objectives for Subordinates
	Gather information and intelligence for Business development
	Ensure the realization of company strategic focus from a Field Operations perspective.
	Timely issuance of job descriptions and job objectives to team members.
	Certify the quality/quantity of equipment & materials for field operations.
	Supervise the preparation of consumables for field operations.
	Prepare and submit monthly operations reports to the Operations Manager (OPM).
	Timely appraisal of the performance of team members.
	Level of development of team members.
	Any other assignment assigned by the Operations Manager (OPM).


Person Specification 


	Minimum qualification - A good first degree
	At least 6 years of experience in the onshore/offshore upstream oil and gas industry.
	Must have an eye for details and be meticulous
	Must possess good leadership skills
	PMP is an added advantage
	Sound knowledge of MS Project/ Primavera/other relevant project management tools
	Familiarity with a project management software like MS Projects or Primavera.


Required Competencies:


	Good leadership skill.
	Good documentation skills.
	Proven bids preparation knowledge.
	Passion to deliver
	Good interpersonal skills
	Analytical skills to define and solve problems.
	Relationship management
	Excellent e-mail skills.
	Good multi-tasking skill.
	Ability to understand, follow and uphold the company’s management QHSE procedures and policies
	An understanding of the various technical processes found in the Upstream sector
	Ability to manage a diverse multi-discipline team to achieve the required output and effective communication skills
	A good understanding of company’s quality management system in conformity with IMS (ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015 and ISO 45001:2018)
	Ability to implement already formulated company strategy.
	Excellent written and spoken English.


Application Closing Date: 16th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV as an attachment (not a link) to: manpower@belloil.com using the Job Position as subject of email.

 

 

3.) Senior Business Development Executive 

Job Locations: Lagos and Port Harcourt - Rivers,
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Assistant Manager - BD / GM - Business Development & Supply Chain

Overall Purpose of the Role


	To assist with the attainment of company’s business growth objectives; articulating new business development opportunities in the upstream sector of the Oil and Gas Industry and compiling bids and collecting projects data.


Responsibilities


	Develop technical and commercial knowledge of all our product offerings and services.
	Contribute to the attainment of the company’s business development strategies.
	Identify immediate and long-term needs by clients for company’s products and services on such projects.
	Arrange meetings between E& P Companies and our partners.
	Liaise between the company and key agencies in the industry in the oil and gas industry.
	Manage day-to-day relationships with partners and clients and develop a deep understanding of their needs.
	Identify application areas on client sites and make appropriate proposal on the benefits and usage of the products.
	Identify and recommend as most appropriate, technical assistance for key customers
	Understand full working of Joint Venture Partners and any new technology.
	Gather new intelligence for the preparation of reports, tenders and presentations that will win the company contracts in on-going and up-coming projects.
	Define strategy for relating with each customer group and create a Customer Relationship Plan per group
	Collate client – specific intelligence and produce weekly reports
	Prospect for and acquire new and financially viable high-volume customers
	Prepare and make effective product presentations to clients.
	Interfacing with industry regulators and follow up on submitted tenders.
	Generate work orders, Request for Quotation (RFQ) and Purchase Orders (PO)
	Effectively manage each customer account to ensure sales targets are fully achieved
	Collate and communicate business intelligence
	Ensure full payment for all supplies and services
	Reconcile customers’ accounts and ensure proper documentation
	Provide regular updates on plans and progress
	Demonstrate consistent sales development success and target – driven achievement.


Person Specification


	A good University degree
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in Technical Sales in the Upstream subsector of the oil and gas industry.


Required Competencies:


	Ideal candidate should have met at least a USD2.5 million annual sales target
	A good knowledge of up-coming and on-going key projects in the upstream sector of the Oil and Gas Sector.
	Good working knowledge of the Nigerian Oil Industry (Upstream sector)
	Proven sales contacts in the Upstream sector of Nigeria’s oil and gas industry
	Proven track record of winning businesses and meeting targets
	Business intelligence gathering skills
	Proven clients account management experience in the Upstream sector of Nigeria’s Oil and Gas industry.
	Self-motivated
	Good written, presentation and oral communication skills
	Proven experience of working with minimum supervision
	Charismatic, social, responsible, passionate about the job.


Application Closing Date: 9th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV as an attachment (not a link) to: manpower@belloil.com using the Job Position as subject of email.
